Class ConfigScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.World
      • ConfigScreen
  • public class ConfigScreen
extends greenfoot.World
    A class representing a configuration screen for the world before you load into the world proper. Has six configurable parameters that are set, then passed into the actual World once the Confirm button is clicked. The parameters change based on which buttons you press.
    Version:
    2.00
    Author:
    Michael Liu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ConfigScreen()
      Constructor for objects of class ConfigScreen.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void act()
      Act method for the Config Screen, updates text to show changes to configuration as well as constantly checking for mouse input.
      void checkMouse()
      A method meant to be called in act, constantly checking if specific Actors (Buttons) have been pressed, and adjusting static fields of the config screen (which are then passed to the main world, again, as static parameters), accordingly.
      int getEnemyHpMultiplier()
      Getter for enemy spawn hp multiplier in the world
      int getEnemySpawnRate()
      Getter for enemy spawn rate in the world
      int getInitialVillagers()
      Getter for initial amount of villagers in the world
      int getResourceGainMultiplier()
      Getter for resource/food gain multiplier in the world
      int getResourceSpawnRate()
      Getter for resource spawn rate in the world
      int getVillagerMaxHP()
      Getter for villagerMaxHP
      void setEnemyHpMultiplier​(int x)
      Setter for enemyHpMultiplier, changes the value of the variable to equal the parameter passed in.
      void setEnemySpawnRate​(int x)
      Setter for enemySpawnRate, changes the value of the variable to equal the parameter passed in.
      void setInitialVillagers​(int x)
      Setter for initialVillagers, changes the value of the variable to equal the parameter passed in.
